docs.lead_paragraph: Tuesday night at the Democratic National Convention in Denver, as recorded by CQ Transcriptions. A complete transcript: nytimes.com/politics.
docs.abstract: Text of excerpts from Hillary Rodham Clinton's remarks at Democratic National Convention
docs.snippet: Tuesday night at the Democratic National Convention in Denver, as recorded by CQ Transcriptions. A complete transcript: nytimes.com/politics.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last week's post about a virtual assistant, Emily Morgan, who had taken an entrepreneurial approach to her work, evoked some heated discussion in the comments about the nature of entrepreneurship. The comments touched on what motivates people to choose different types of work arrangements, particularly whether the trappings that tend to accompany employment, like health insurance and paid vacation time, are more valuable than those that flow to the self-employed -- like the ability to choose which projects to work on, the flexibility to work how and where a person wants, and a general feeling of controlling one's destiny.
docs.abstract: Perks at work -- which ones matter so much that you'd leave if you couldn't have them?
docs.snippet: Perks at work -- which ones matter so much that you'd leave if you couldn't have them?

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation warned Tuesday that the nation's ailing banking industry was likely to weaken further.
docs.abstract: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation warned Tuesday that the nation's ailing banking industry was likely to weaken further. In its latest quarterly report on the industry, the regulator said earnings at banks and thrifts declined 86 percent from April to June, to $4.96 billion, from $36.8 billion a year earlier.

docs.lead_paragraph: The 2007 income, poverty and health insurance numbers are out. As far as I can tell on a first read, there's nothing deeply surprising. Still, they represent a landmark -- and not in a good way.
docs.abstract: The 2007 income, poverty and health insurance numbers are out. As far as I can tell on a first read, there's nothing deeply surprising. Still, they represent a landmark - and not in a good way. The key point is that 2007 was the end of an economic expansion - whether or not the NBER [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Chrysler is poised to offer in its 2009 models a new entertainment option for the children: Wi-Fi and Internet connectivity. The problem is that the entire car becomes a hot spot.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Jennifer Lynn Kulp, a daughter of Carolyn J. Kulp and John L. Kulp Jr. of Titusville, N.J., was married on Saturday evening to Dr. Danil Victor Makarov, a son of Galina A. Makarov and Victor I. Makarov of Old Greenwich, Conn. Diane Smith-Hoban, who is affiliated with Journeys of the Heart, a nondenominational religious organization, officiated at Washington Crossing Historic Park in Washington Crossing, Pa.
